title: How to hire a freelance content writer, what will be his pay - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi, There are some basic requirements you need to do before hiring and getting your work done by the freelancer: Use social sites or any adv. website where you could post ads for free to hire a content writer.There are various websites which offers to post or search for freelancers.When you get enough requests or proposals, you shortlist all your desire candidates and make there names aside.Now, you've to brows their profiles and try to know about their work capabilities whether they could really be capable of doing your work as you desire.Make a contact with them and ask them for the interview.You may also ask their exp. letter etc. to check their eligibility because freelancing task must be completed within the given period of time.Share or send your files to them as you want. You may use any method for this.You’re all done.Now, as you've asked to pay, this depends upon your work type and complexity etc. Thank You!

Top Freelance content writers in India Finding a dedicated freelance writer who can cater to your requirements in the best possible way can be a pain in the ass. Every day we used to get many requests where clients asked for freelance content writers who could be entrusted with the task of writing efficiently. Thus, I have curated the list of Top Freelance Writers from India based on people’s recommendation. I got more than 70 recommendations and choosing the best of the lot was indeed a tedious task. I have personally checked their portfolio, client testimonials before jotting down my Top 10 List of Freelance Writers. I think that this list of Top 10 Freelance Writers can help you with content creation, content marketing and content strategy work. I have covered all kind of writers who can handle various niches ranging from technology to health and fitness.This is not a promotional or sponsored post, I haven’t charge anything for anyone. I am also not an affiliate to any people mention here in the list. 1. MUKTI MASIHMukti Masih has been writing content for more than 14 years now, starting her stint with The Times of India. Her three years of experience as a journalist taught her how to balance facts with the right blend of emotions to strike a chord with readers/customers. She has in her kitty market leaders such as Vinfotech (leading fantasy sports app development company); Akshaya Patra (NGO that’s running world’s largest mid-day meal scheme); LetsShave (India’s Most Promising Brand award winner); InstaCar(Central India’s first funded start-up and fastest growing intercity cab startup) and The Crowd Sourcing Week Magazine (Singapore and New York-based magazine on crowdsourcing economy); Sayaji Group of Hotels among others. Her strength is original content with the right blend of personal touch and a selling strategy. Since she is an avid traveller, she gets to write engaging startup stories for YourStory and travel stories for various publications. She has so far written 200+ video scripts, 100+ websites, over 12,000 blog posts and around 4,000 social media posts. She is also the co-founder of a leading video production house AVM Pictures. Why are they one of the best?Mukti is a complete content strategist who treats every piece of writing like her own personal blog. She inevitably brings out a human angle that resonates with the customers in her content. She knows that more than 1/3rd of consumer decisions are based on emotions, not facts. Her stories, articles and blogs are credible because they are well-researched, aptly source-credited and full of interesting analogies. She would invariably bring in a Batman movie reference in a startup story or a Breaking Bad reference in a big data article. This makes her content most relatable to her readers.
